fields.question: What are Dim Lights?
fields.opt_1: Lights that are to be used at all times, as one should not risk blinding other drivers
fields.opt_2: Lights which are switched on when it is getting dark. They are also switched on for a short distance viewing of oncoming vehicles
fields.opt_3: Lights found inside the vehicle cabin that serve those inside the vehicle
fields.opt_4: Lights that are used to indicate one's intention to turn
fields.right_opt: Lights which are switched on when it is getting dark. They are also switched on for a short distance viewing of oncoming vehicles

fields.question: What are parking dim lights?
fields.opt_1: Lights that are turned on when a vehicle is at a stop
fields.opt_2: Lights that indicates one's intention to park their vehicle
fields.opt_3: Lights used in low visibility conditions where a lot of light is necessary
fields.opt_4: Lights that are switched on at 6: 45 AM or when it is raining or dusty.
fields.right_opt: Lights that are switched on at 6: 45 AM or when it is raining or dusty.

fields.question: What are full lights?
fields.opt_2: Lights used on highways to enable the driver see further
fields.opt_3: Lights that are to be used at all times irrespective of the environmental conditions
fields.opt_4: Lights that are used to indicate one's intention to turn
fields.right_opt: Lights used on highways to enable the driver see further

fields.question: What are hazard lights?
fields.opt_1: These are vehicle lights that flash at the front and back of the car. They are switched on when they is a hazard or danger.
fields.opt_2: Hazard lights are used to indicate that one needs to stop immediately
fields.opt_3: They can also be used when overtaking at high speed
fields.opt_4: They can best be used at night when visibility is high
fields.right_opt: These are vehicle lights that flash at the front and back of the car. They are switched on when they is a hazard or danger.

fields.question: What are Indicator lights?
fields.opt_1: Lights used to signal other drivers of one's intention to stop
fields.opt_2: Lights that turn on automatically when one applies the brakes
fields.opt_3: Lights that are only used when its necessary to alert other drivers that one is turning
fields.opt_4: Lights that are used to provide signals to other users when changing lanes, reversing and parking.
fields.right_opt: Lights that are used to provide signals to other users when changing lanes, reversing and parking.

fields.question: What are brake lights?
fields.opt_1: Lights that are only used when its necessary to alert other drivers that one is turning
fields.opt_2: These are lights that indicate the vehicle is applying brakes.
fields.opt_4: Lights that are only used in low visibility conditions
fields.right_opt: These are lights that indicate the vehicle is applying brakes.

fields.question: When can you turn on the lights during day time?
What is a vehicle?
fields.opt_1: A four wheeled machine used for transportation

fields.question: What is a lane?
fields.opt_3: It is a path to be followed by the vehicle
fields.opt_4: Is a road made of tarmac
fields.right_opt: It is a path to be followed by the vehicle

fields.question: Who is a pedestrian?
fields.opt_3: A person who does not own a car

fields.question: Kenyan drivers are supposed to drive on which side of the road?
fields.opt_3: Drivers are free to switch to their preffered side
fields.opt_4: None of the above is correct

fields.question: Which side do you overtake from in Kenya?
fields.opt_3: From any side, depending on traffic conditions

fields.question: Which one of the following is NOT one of the three documents which must be valid before you are allowed to drive?
Which category of vehicles do NOT have a right of way?
What is the maximum driving speed limit in town?
